alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 10:54AM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible for the Flathead valley and along the shores of Flathead Lake, including Kalispell. 3 to 5 inches possible through the Mission valley. Blowing and drifting snow as winds gust up to 50 mph with blizzard-like conditions, dangerously cold wind chills and a freeze up on roadways is possible Tuesday morning in the Flathead valley, and Tuesday afternoon for the Mission valley. * WHERE...Flathead Lake, Flathead Valley, Mission Valley, and Polson. * WHEN...From Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
